description:
The Role: Senior Sales Manager (Conference Sponsorship and Advertising)

The Location: New York, Houston, Denver

The Team: The Conferences, Training & Strategic Media team manages a portfolio of cross-commodity industry-leading events and media solutions. We engage, and connect clients, business leaders and industry experts in an environment of knowledge excellence to extend insights capture the moment and take critical conversations forward on key topics in the Energy and related arenas.

The team delivers approximately twenty global events per year, engaging industry at C-Suite and executive levels, showcasing our own Energy, Oil, Gas, Chemicals and Commodities experts across a wide range of markets and pricing dynamics. Our focus Energy Transition where we offer a unique sector- leading capability. Our industry Training enables companies to maintain strong human resource capabilities in a competitive and complex marketplace of technical and business expertise. Our Strategic Media solutions support marketing initiatives of leading corporations worldwide.

The Impact: The Senior Sales Manager is a critical part of our growth trajectory in generating new revenue and engaging new clients, by building and executing a dynamic sales strategy to achieve ambitious revenue growth for our events and strategic media. Our Sales activity intersects with the S&P Global sales team for wider effect and offers clients a platform to access our extensive global reach.

Responsibilities:
• Generate conference sponsorship, digital advertising, and printed advertising revenue by opening new opportunities through face-to-face and telephone selling.
• Actively seek out and follow through on new prospects from all relevant sources. Actively source and develop new business areas relevant to the events and to the strategic media plan.
• Build strong and long-term relationships to maximize client engagement.
• Improve growth and retention of the existing business through strategic account management.
• Joint responsibility for all sectors of the event including sales planning, campaign management, forecasting, and achieving the sales target.
• Preparation of event specific sales plans and use market knowledge to input into the overall strategic direction of the conference.
• Maintain effective relationships with:
• Internal sales team ensuring that they are fully briefed on conference details. Regularly monitor their revenue generation for your event and escalate any issues as appropriate.
• Trade associations, either as a strategic partner and/or as a S&P Global customer.
• Fully understand the event model and the strategic media model.
• Communicate across all disciplines (production, marketing, operations, finance) to ensure market intelligence is shared in order to maximize on potential opportunities.
• Accurately and efficiently manage the sales dashboard and the sales pipeline.
• Maintain and update the sales pipeline with relevant contacts, notes and market intelligence.
• Monitor and plan own [and team] sales activity and regularly monitor the sales pipeline accordingly.
• Work with marketing to manage the entire sales promotion campaign ensuring targeted, timely and appropriate communications are sent out to the prospect base. Full management of campaigns and tracking of sales plan effectiveness.
• Work closely with the event team to develop targeted partners promotional campaigns according to the sales plan.
• Have a creative approach with a keen eye on revenue generation from event related and non-event related activities and participate in ad hoc business projects as required.
• Attend S&P Global events and competitor, industry and trade association events (both domestically and internationally) thereby obtaining industry and market intelligence, maintaining and creating new relationships, expanding the database and prospecting for new business.
• Write sales reports as required.
• Work with finance on debt collection pre and post show.

What We’re Looking For: A target driven and enthusiastic sales professional who can demonstrate the following:
• 10 years strong sales experience in a relevant environment (conferences sponsorship, digital advertising, publishing, etc.) with a track record in generating new business.
• Knowledge of Energy, Oil, Gas, Chemicals and Commodities sectors preferred.
• Proven experience in consultative and value led selling, negotiating and objection handling, maximizing revenue from new and existing customers by demonstrating innovation and creativity in ideas.
• Proven experience in international sales and tailoring the selling style to reflect cultural etiquette.
• An ability to assimilate and practice key account management principles.
• An ability to build long-term, sustainable and profitable relationships with customers.
• Excellent interpersonal skills at all levels.
• Strong written and oral communication skills, including presentations and report writing.
• Empathy and understanding of other cultures within a commercial context.
• Experience in developing and implementing successful Sales Strategies.
• Ability to assess and explain the long-term impact of new practices by undertaking a high level of analysis to assess risk.
• Keen eye for development of additional revenue opportunities outside of personal area of responsibility.

Return to Work

Have you taken time out for caring responsibilities and are now looking to return to work? As part of our Return to Work initiative (link to career site page when available), we are encouraging enthusiastic and talented returners to apply, and will actively support your return to the workplace.

Grade/Level (relevant for internal applicants only): Grade 11

About Company Statement:

S&P Global delivers essential intelligence that powers decision making. We provide the world’s leading organizations with the right data, connected technologies and expertise they need to move ahead. As part of our team, you’ll help solve complex challenges that equip businesses, governments and individuals with the knowledge to adapt to a changing economic landscape.

S&P Global Commodity Insights enables organizations to create long-term, sustainable value with data and insights for a complete view on the global energy and commodities markets.
